newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech CNB fixes crown -3.74 pct vs mark/usd basket.
newsitem.headline: Czech CNB fixes crown -3.74 pct vs mark/usd basket.

text.p: The Czech National Bank (CNB) fixed the crown at 30.824 to the dollar after Thursday's fixing at 30.629, and at 18.220 to the mark from 18.081.
The above rates imply a deviation from the midpoint of the central bank's mark/dollar basket of -3.74 percent, after a deviation of -3.00 on Thursday.
During the minute at which the central bank calculated today's fixing, the crown was trading on the interbank market at -3.88 percent.
The crown fixing is announced daily at about 1140 CET (0940) GMT), and is within plus/minus 7.5 percent of the mark/dollar basket midpoint calculated between 11:30:00 and 11:30:59 CET.

The crown has taken a hammering over the past few days, although the currency was calmer today after yesterday's record lows. But dealers warn that the threat of speculative selling remains and domestic buying of hard currency may destabilise the crown further later in the day.
